bioghist.p: Humphrey Morrey (1650-1716) was the first mayor of Philadelphia, serving from 1691 to 1701. He had substantial real estate holdings in Cheltenham Township and in the city, including the greater portion of the block bounded by Front, Second, Chestnut, and Water Streets. Upon his death, his son Richard (d. 1754) and his grandson Humphrey (d. 1735) inherited his properties. Richard Morrey and his first wife Ann had a son, Thomas, who also died in 1735.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of ground rents collected for various properties in Philadelphia belonging to Humphrey, Richard, and Thomas Morrey. Receipts are noted for quarterly and yearly payments on dwellings in Front, Chestnut, and Water Streets in Philadelphia.
